Figure <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> shows the position of the block as a function of time. Figure <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> shows the force exerted by the spring on the block as a function of time.

(b)

i. Using figures <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> and <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math>, determine an expression for the spring constant of the spring.

(c) On the axes provided in Figure <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> sketch a graph of the velocity of the block as a function of time.

(d) A student sketches the free-body diagram in Figure <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math>, and makes the following claim:

“The free-body diagram shows the forces exerted on the block at time <math alttext="t equals 1.5 times t sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>”.
